Please note that I am NOT an Indian food lvoer - in fact - I generally don't eat it.  I can't deal with all the cardamom and curry and fenugreek and such.  I will be generous and give it 4 stars - but my conscious is screaming "3 stars".  I reall would like to see them succeed.  The Callohwhill area needs new businesses.

But 3 of us had a very lovely dinner there last week.  The place was nearly empty - but you can see that the decor (which is lovely) is brand new.  The ladies room was clean and marble-ized and nice.

Service was very attentive - some might argue a bit much - as he asked my husband if he'd like to order any bread 3 times.  (I ordered a poori - with Shrimp as an appetizer which was fabulous in all its deep-fried glory).  My husband did not want any bread.

Really.

Our friend who dined with us is FROM India - and he ordered a Chana (can't remember) appetizer which we all enjoyed but it was served on a bed of shredded ice berg lettuce - which would NEVER happen in India.

The Lamb Curry was tender and mildly spiced.
The rice was excellent - as well cooked basmati can be.

I would go back - but again - I am just not an Indian Food lover.  For Philly - this seems like the best of the lot.  For betetr Indo-Pak food try Queens NY or North Jersey.

Oh - our dessert (Galub - can't spell it) fried cheese balls, was syrupy and friend and just as I rememberfrom the Dipavali festivals I used to attend.  Yum-my.

Oh - it's BYOB - so BRING something. (We didn't and wished that we had.)


Dinner for the 3 of us was $60 even including tax & tip.  Really not bad.

Quality has been slipping over the years.  I have gone to Mizu since it first opened (now there are 3 of them in Philly),  Back then it was dirt-cheap (which always makes me suspicious when dealing with raw, fresh fish) and very, very good.

Today, Mizu offers a limited selection of fish - the basics like tuna, salmon and yellowtail and also standard rolls.  Prices are low to moderate and they give you BIG portions.  A roll is really 1.5 rolls - 12 pieces.

Mike, the owner, is rarely ever at the Original 20th Street location - and the sushi bar chefs I used to know well are not there anymore.  I am hopeful they can recapture the service and freshness level they had when they first opened.

Incidentally - they make an excellent Hwe Dup Bop and tasty Gyoza and Shumai are cheap (frozen - not home made).

It's a 3 star place but I am giving 4 stars for the extremely well-executed holiday party we threw here for our party of 9.

Granted, the food was family style - which meant it all came out promptly - but it was actually good (Chicken Parm, Chicken Marsala and a baked ziti with meat in it).  Best of all were the huge platters of (very good) tira-misu.

Chrissy our server brought cappuccino and beverages right away.

Considering how busy and crowded the restaurant was (and the place is huge) with every holiday party under the sun - groups from 6 to 36 at long tables - the service was AMAZINGLY good.

For a faux-talian chain.
Stopped in on a DEAD Sunday night at 30th Street Station and needed good coffee.  Old Nelson Hooked me up with a REAL La Colombe Latte for under $2.00.  SCORE!!!!

Wow - I can't even believe I am writing this.  My 4 year old daughter and I were in China Town yesterday - and we walked into Angel Beauty - a Shiseido Store - when we asked if they do nails - the lead us into a back room - which was GORGEOUS and clean and wonderful.

For 5 bux, dd had a polish change.  There was a lady there having reflexology done, and they had 3-4 pedi-chairs.

Definitely will return.

Not scary at all - just completely unexpected.

We have not yet decided which phone to purchase and where but I was impressed by "George from Ridley Park" and his knowledge of the products and plans.

Very nice!

Well, it doesn't feel "New"
And the hoagies are NOT "Tiny"
But the 6 inch Chicken Cheese Steak I got was great - and the friendly young lad at the counter was personable AND good looking.

I don;t eat hoagies often - but when I want one I'll be skipping Wawa and heading straight here!

Plus they deliver (even out my way in the boonies) for $1.50 charge - $10 minimum.

I will try the pizza soon and let you know...
So far great for steaks/hoagies.

Take out ONLY (not where to sit - not even a card table).

Friendly service and BIG portions of very good food. However the prices are too high.  I'd gladly come more often to get a lower priced platter (I like platters better than sandwiches) and a smaller portion.

That said, for $11.95 I took 1/2 my meal (lots of great rice, Doner and roasted tomato plus lavash) home.  And it came with a fountain drink (again - knock $1.50 off and I'd gladly skip that - I like water.)

Super-friendly ladies offered us samples of the savory beef stew.  (My friend ordered that).

Lovely!

Stopped in last night (walked in did not use drive thru) and the place was empty at 8 PM.
I actually thought they were closing, but they were just cleaning.

Very nice shift manager and 2 female baristas.

Got my kid a Peach Iced Green tea Lemonade and I got a Grande Caramel Macchiatto.
Both were just perfect.

No issues.
This is a fun place to browse around.  Great T-s, clothes & accessories all with the Sailor Jerry "tattoo" motif.  Thanks to McThrill for the wikipedia history lesson.

Philadelphia's answer to NYC's Gracious Home, Fosters offers upscale, classy bath, kitchen and home decor.  They also have cooking classes and other home-related workshops here.

It is pricey - but if you need a certain something - they can get it for you.
A great place for unique house-warming gifts, too.

Glad it's here!

3,5 stars - for deli-style sandwiches, cheese-steaks, hoagies and iceberg based salads.  Long lines that move quickly during the lunch rush.  Bren - who has worked here for years - is a doll.

I'll be back!

Lots of fun to poke around the old-time-feeling Booth's Corner's Farmers Market.  Not as much produce and food as I expected - and alot more gift and knick-knack shops - even a LAWYER has a stall here.

I especially like Esh's Eggs and Stoltfuz meats and produce.

Only open Friday - Sunday.
Wish they had more days open.

Had GREAT service when refilling a prescription here early today at 7:55 AM.
Pharmacy Manager (female) is very sweet and entered my new insurance information and got me my medication promptly.

No issues.

Located in a Shopping Center in Plumsteadville - of all places - this place has decent NY style Neapolitan pies.  Get one fresh made - as the pre-made slices can vary in quality depending on when they were made - but you CAN'T go wrong with a fresh baked pie from here.  Cheesy and not too greasy.  Good stuff.

A nice array of whole and fileted fish, frozen crustaceans, battered ready-to-fry items and smoked salmons.  You can also have a seafood meal prepared to eat at the market - but I have never done this.  I have bought shrimp and Halibut here both were fine. (Fresh and not fishy smelling.)

Not bad.  A homey little place for pizza and sandwiches. Beverly, the sassy waitress will bring you your order and a sunny smile.

The Red veggie pie (no sauce) was delicious and at $8.50 for a small was perfect for 2 of us to share.

Once time for lunch I had a tasty tuna melt. 

The dining room can get very crowded (and loud) at lunch time so come right at or before 12 noon to get a seat.

Oh - and that home-made Lemon Crunch cake looked mighty tempting.  Maybe next time...

OK, first of all, I am not gay - I am a straight, married, corporate chick with a young kid and a pug dog - and I LOVE WOODY's.

I come by myself on Wednesday Nights for the best cheap Italian food around - and an Arnold Palmer.

The gay community is alive & well at Woody's and the DJs have the tunes pumpin' - but I go early and have a quiet little dinner.  Usually I get the fabulous Chicken Francese or Marsala.  They serve the meals with fresh bread, a plate of Olive Oil and a roasted long-hot pepper.

The crabmeat salad - appetizer or entree size (I get the small one and it's still huge) is fresh and tasty.  The pasta is al dente.

And... the eye candy is a bonus - even for a straight-chick like me.

Needed a drug test (aka Pee in a Cup) for a new job.
Got in & out as a walk-in although there was a LONG line at opening.

No issues.

They are going out of business in late August so get there NOW to pick through the last of their gorgeous dresses, separates 
and prom-worthy Formal gowns all for 40% off.

We will miss it here. Sorella's always carried beautiful clothes.

Old-school toy stores are getting harder and harder to find (Thanks a lot, Toyz-R-Hell!) so Pun's really saved us a few years back when our then 4 year old needed a hard to find plush Gund toy.  Pun's found it for us!

Excellent.

So very pleased with the food & service here.  The ladies at the counter are terrific!
I am now a semi-regular and get both eat-in and take out lunches here.

A little pricey *(I spent close to $13 today) but I get nearly 2 meals out of it.  (Or a meal and a snack).  And now - my 10 year old kid is hooked.  She loves the food here.

The Doner and Barg are my faves (as a platter).

This Starbucks just moved "down the street" from the Paoli train Station (where there was NO PARKING) to here - where the old Burger King used to be.  

I have not yet gone into the store, but I used the convenient drive-thru today and got in & out quickly.

Glad there is parking!

This is a GREAT restaurant and it's more American than Italian.  Quiche and sammies for lunch and yummy pierogies.  (Yes, really.)

We love coming here to de-compress after Peddler's Village madness.

Good service and good homey food.

Great cupcakes - in particular the straberry shortcake - which doeesn't even contain any chocolate.

They serve 4-5 kinds of hot chocolate.

It's such a fun and SWEET place.

Alas, no nudity.

Excellent choice for a casual lunch, and on a nice day you can sit outside.  I got the "Breeders combo" (The restaurant is dog themed) with a 1/2 size Cobb Salad and a cup of delicious lobster bisque (not much lobster in it, but still tasty).  Next time I will try the mushroom bisque.

They have alotta bisques - and chicken noodle.

The sandwich my friend got look great, too.

Can't wait to come back.
Hannah (Cashier and later in dining area) was a doll.

CUtesy doggie boutique with EXPENSIVE treats and toys.  Cute outfits, leashes, collars and everything your pooch could want.

But you'll pay for it!

Yumi (Server/hostess) is a doll and always treats us so well whether I come alone for lunch or with a friend or my 10 year old (who, incidentally, loves it here).


Today I tried the Pork Dumpling soup and was so pleasantly surprised by how wonderful it was.  3 gyoza (likely frozen - but so tasty) and a savory broth - but best of all?  Chock full of veggies - napa Cabbage, Carrots, Shredded Snow Peas (so sweet) and Mushroom slivers.

I LOVED IT.

The $13.95 Chirashi lunch is a steal - a la cart there is a good $20 worth of tuna, salmon, yellowtail, fluke (or some other white fish) and snapper on the plate.

No 5th star?  Frozen tamago.
How I long for good home-made tamago!

Meanwhile, I enjoy the food here very much - and now they know me!

Came here again (and again) and it's still greta and still a great value at $8/95 for a 3 course sit down lunch.

Masaman Curry or Pad-See_Ew are my faves here.  Soooo tasty.

And Pookie - one of the servers - is a doll.

We had already discovered Darlings as a great spot to take our 3 year old for Mac 'n Cheese (there's is so yummy) before we decided to plan a playdate at the Please Touch Museum.

After the playdate we pre-arranged with Darlings (they are so very small) to have all 6 kids and about 9 parents drop by for lunch at 1 PM.

Darlings was great about us taking over the joint.  The kids had PB & J and of course plently of mac 'n cheese.  The parents had lots of cheesecake and mexi-bowls (can't remember the excact name) but it's like a bowl of rice, beans, taco meat and Mexican fisings.  Very yummy.

No a/c (ugh) and they take CASH ONLY so be forewarned.

A great place to eat after going to the Please Touch or Franklin Institute.
Still lovin' it here.

Some of the best popcorn, bulk-roasted in-shell peanuts and chocolate covered treats (pretzels, graham crackers) in Philly.

Such a fun little place crammed with snackies.

4 stars for $6.99 Taco Tuesdays - I usually get the fish tacos (You get 2 tacos and a side of Beans).  You have to get it to go.

I also get a (pricey) $2.50 Strawberry Ginger Iced Tea (They Used Premium Steap teas and I love them).

Fast service - especially if you call your order in and then go pick it up.

I had a much, much better experience a few years later at the Victoria's secret in Glen Mills (Brinton Lake Shopping Center).  I came in November early for holiday shoppig and was able to get some leggings and a pre-boxed (yeah, I am a sucka for cute packaging) loungewear PINK set for my 13 year old.

She will be happy and I got my one, lonely free panty.

She gets $115 worth of stuff and I get one. lonely. panty.

Gotta love motherhood.

The new store manager is terrific - I sure wish i could remember her name - she told me but I forgot.  She is friendly and great.

Go take your kids to a BlueRocks game - it's such fun - the seats are all good ones - and it's affordable, family fun.

We love coming here for BlueRocks games.

And don't forget Mr. Celery!

I needed keys made - and even though the place was mobbed (the Sunday of Thanksgiving weekend) I zipped in and out and the lady made my 2 keys and they WORKED.

Yay!

I am torn between 4 and 5 stars.  I love to get fresh dairy cheeses here and also Grana Padano and other Grating cheeses.  The line can get lengthy as they serve each person as an individual (which is nice.)  Worth the wait for yummy cheese!!!!

I am NOT a temple student.  I got a take out menu from here in my building and stared at it for weeks before taking the plunge.

Last night I justs DID NOT want to cook, so I ordered food for myself, 5 year old DD and DH (who decided not to eat any).

The order took 45 minutes to arrive and was wrong when it got here, plus I was charged for 2 $4.99 orders of items I never ordered.  "Ron " on the phone has said he will be refunding my credit card, so I am on the lookout for that refund.

Meanwhile the food we did order was good.  Fried dumplings ($4.99 for tem) were crisp and tasty.  $1.00 each for spring rolls (also fried - it was a fried food fiesta) were good too.  Tempura shrimp was stuffed with a SPICY sauce.  Won;t be ordering that again.

The main dish - Bul gogi was very good, but a bit scant on the meat (but wha'dya want for $7.99).

In my opinion Goji is much better food, but for take-out this Korean/Japanese hybrid is a great alternative to Chines or Pizza.

We will order again - next time from "The Line".  Or maybe a Bibim Bap.  I loves me a good bap!

If you are a student and live on take-out - we suggest you give Koja a try.  Just read your receipt!!!!

I've had Old City iced coffee many, many times at the RTM location.  I like that they keep the milk IN THE FRIDGE (not sitting out in pitchers) and pour you as much or as little as you wish (soy, skim, whole or half 'n half).

Thanks for NOT being a Charbucks.

Great coffee and a fun place to just hang out.
And a pleasant older gentleman and a nice young lady barrista to boot!

I love the coffee at Old City Coffee.  I will continue to come here.

Went here for an eat-in lunch for the first time ever!  (I come here alot for breakfast but it's always grab 'n go.)

Was it ever good.  We were seating promptly by Tony - the sassy waitress, and offered water (or whatever we'd like to drink) right away.  Both I and my dining companion ordered the "Greek Chicken" special.  A grilled (or breaded if you like) chicken breast topped with melted provolone and FRESH, green spinach leaves.  Mnnn!  So great.

In lieu of fries (I don't do fried), I got green beans - and I expected diner-esque.  They were anything but!  The grean beans were bright, green, crisp and perfectly seasoned with a bit of garlic salt.  TASTY STUFF.

The meal was served with a roll & butter - and for whatever reason, when Tony asked "You wanna roll & butter?" I said yes. 

Another pleasant surprise!  A braided, yellow egg roll (like a mini challah bun) appeared, quartered and perfectly buttered.  Alas, my thighs, I ate the carbs!

A delightful inexpensive lunch, served on paper plates, eaten with plastic silverware, in the company of local cops and working folk.

Oh - lunch costs $10 bucks exact including tax 'n tip.

Pay up front!

I heart Yonni's.

Catered hoagie trays for a corporate lunch - and it was fine.  Ham, turkey and roastbeef on seeded rolls, lettuce, tomatoes and cheap white American cheese.  (Mayo pre-spread on the turkey hoagie-piece I ate.)

Served with may small bags of Herr's chips.

No issues.

I hadn't been back here for years - but I needed a masage in the worst way so I booked 30 minutes with Gabby (she's terrific, by the way) and was so pleasantly surprised by the renovations to thelobby floor, the privacy of the rooms (They have DOORS now - not just fabric panels.

I will be back - at $45 for 30 minutes ($80 for an hour) it's great in a pinch.

5 star service from Vera and 3.5 star (heavy, carbo-loaded, caloric) food.
A gal-pal and I shared the whopping-huge "Marco's Meal" and took home most of it.

With the $42.95 (We paid $52.95 - as we each opted for upgraded entrée choices) you get EITHER an appetizer (we got the $10.95 stuffed mushrooms - very good.) OR 2 small side salads.

Then you pick 2 entrees (Classic pastas only.  If you want "special pastas" or a chicken dish - pay $5 more).  

Then you get 2 "classic" pastas (cold and pre-prepared/wrapped that morning) to take home.

And ANY dessert you want to share (we got the $7.95 hunk-o'-cheesecake).

But VERA (serving here for about a decade!) is the best part of all.  She is hilarious and warm and wonderful.

Is the food "haute"?  "Fine cuisine"?  Heck, no.  This is a chain.
The digs are cafeteria-meets-checkered table cloth "Faux-talian".

But we had fun - and left with enough for 2 more meals.

Easily!

P.S.  The pricey cappuccinos here are actually GREAT.  Get a cappuccino in lieu of dessert.  Good stuff!

Consistently good.
Had a 3-roll maki combo lunch for $11.95 which is a great value (comes with salad only for take out, sould and salad when you eat in).

Try the crispy eggplant app - so good!

Cute shops, restaurants, a hair salon and outdoor events in the spring & summer.  I fun place for sure!

Parking can be a trick though - so I take a bus and walk a few blocks.

Yay!  I am the first to review!

Oh, I have such sentimentality for Borghi's - so perhpas my 4 stars should not be 4 - but merely 3?  But my (now husband then) boyfriend and I had our first ROMANTIC (third real) date at Borghi's back in 2005 and the meal was great (and dessert was even better - hubba, hubba).

We attempted to have our wedding rehearsal dinner here in 2008 but it was just cost prohibitive for our large group.  Dino, the owner, was very nice to work with and I am sure this would be a great place to have an anniversary or birthday (special occiasion) meal or party.

We enjoyed the veal chicken and pasta dishes we had (both back in 2005 and more recently.).

My parents don't really like it - they think it's too expensive - but I say for a special occaision - Borghi's is a great place.

And it's in the historic Chalfont Inn Building - which is easy to find.  (Right on 202.)

Please leave your young children at home.

Always crowded at peak lunch times - especially when its raining.

Loaded with lawyers and other corporate types, the $16 grilled fish is wonderful for a healthier choice.  They also have burgers and a wonderful veggie burger wrap.

Nice addition to the area - and way more upscale than the Saladworks that used to be in this space.

We had PHENOMENAL service at Aloha (Happy) hour at Roy's last night.
It started off rather rocky - my DD & I walked in (SHE wanted to go.  So I humoured her.)  The hostess seated us (reluctantly) at high tables overlooking the kitchen, but wecould not get the $5.00 bar specials there.

So we moved to the bar, but legally, DD can't sit there.

So we got a HIGH bar table at the edge ot the bar and ate some (decent not great) shumai, lobster potsticker (the best thing we had - very good buttery sauce) plate and lobster california roll. (Good - and comped by the manager).

The manager, Edward was terrific and even brought a BIG box of toys for DD to play with.  After our meal he gave us a tour of their private party rooms.  GREAT!

Hannan (spelling??) our servers was terrific as well.

OK food - and great service.  For $5.00 - a great deal.  Still have trouble believing this is a CHAIN.
Glad it's here - but it is expensive - you are paying for convenience.  Also the deli (Dietz & Watson) looked nice - but just didn't appeal.

My childhood classmate, Kim's parents own this and are accomplished musicians and music teachers.  Its a great (and long time) Bucks COunty resource for instruments, music lessons and all things folk.

Love it!

OK, I am updating my review and giving Jake's an extra star due to the wonderful customer service we received.  The man behind the counter recognixed us from yelp and automatically knew to cut my little daughter's slice in half and gave her a generous side of black olives, gratis.

They also now (sometimes) carry milk.

The pizza that night, also, was fresh and wonderful.  try to get pies when they are just coming out of the oven - or order a whole pie (we get a small, which is still way too much for the 2 of us) and that way it is guaranteed to be oven-fresh.

Yay, Jake's.  Our neighborhood pizza spot keeps getting better.

A decent place to drop off shoes for a shine or minor repairs like new heels or soles.  I have had several pairs of leather loafers, 1/2 boots (ankle boots) and dress pumps shined here.  Decent prices and they have never lost anything.  That's a big plus.

This is a great (small) asset to the neighborhood.  Selling cases of beer, soda and ice.

Believe me - when you need it -it's great to have someone who sells ice.

Bring cash.

A big Gold Crown Hallmark store in the Shopping Center at 252 & Rt. 3.
Friendly staff and I went during a sale and got some good gifts very inexpensively.

I attended the NWCT (Network of Women in Computer Technology) annual conference in Center City and La Prima did the catered (hot) lunch.

The chicken francese, salad, rice pilaf, rolls & butter, and assorted dessert trays were all delicious and well presented in a buffet style.  Service by at least 5-6 uniformed serves was great also.

My one complaint?  The vegetarian option - penne pasta (Cold and swimming in oil) served with a caponata (way too vinegary) was not to my taste - but others enjoyed it.  I was glad they offered some veg-friendly fare.

Best of all - they use recycled materials wherever possible and are about as "green" as a caterer can be!

Still open!!!!  Thank goodness.
Just got me some veal and chicken parm to stock the freezer for those nights when I just don't wanna cook.

This was the "Y" I grew up at.  Day camps in the summer, Indian Guide, Indian Princesses, The seekers, swimming in the indoor pool, working out at the fitness center, the locker rooms, classes in art & music, theatre & cooking.

But wow - now it is expanding and getting absolutely HUGE.

A great commuinty resource.  Expensive to join - but if you will use the facilities and take the classes - well worth it.  Got kids?  cConsider joining!
They moved!!!!

We had a corporate pizza lunch for about 40 people and brought in Anthony's salad and 15 pies including a very good Margarita pie, meatballs with roasted peppers and of course pepperoni.

They also had a cauliflower crust pie which disappeared so quickly that I did not get a chance to try it.

While I am not a big pizza fan, Anthony's is quite good. A nice alternative to the ubiquitous sandwich trays we usually get for catered lunches.

Good job!

Brand-spankin'-new Whole Paycheck in Glen Mills.
So happy to have access to my beloved Hint Water, Frozen meals, Fresh fabulous produce, bakery items, olives and so much more.

I love Whole Foods - prices be darned -sometimes I just gotta blow $70 on maple syrup, water and fruit.
My husband will freak, but hey - we gotta eat.
It's not like I'm buying meth.

Anyhow - I am grateful that a Whole Foods opened near us.  (I miss my branch in Center City.)

This location has been a coffee place, a somehthing else (I forget) and now it's Old Nelson - which sells a little bit of everything.  Cereal, coffee (La Colombe, even!) and breakfast foods, sandwiches at lunch, snacks, chips, beverages, paper goods (at a pricey premium - but convenient).

Glad they are here and hope they make it in this highish-rent ever changing location.
We have had keys made here and purchased supplies.  No issues.

I've had 2, 3 and 4 star experiences at du Jour - but the food is always great.  The service (and crowds - especially on rainy lunch hours) can make or break the experience.

Today, however, the stars were all in alignment.

Perfect iced tea.
Delicious (grilled mahi) fish tacos
Speedy, friendly server

Hooray!

A bit more money that I usually like to soend at lunch - but perfect for business and much better food than Bistro St. tropez or the other places we are often forced to visit.

AVOID during peak times, if you can (12:10 PM - 1:45 PM is the height of the madness).  Get there at 11:50 AM and the place is EMPTY.

Very nice staff!
I popped in (famished) to the Chetserbrook Manhattan bagel and needed to get both breakfast AND lunch.

The Avocado BLT (Turkey Bacon) thin on whole wheat was delicious - and the added cucumber to it upon my request.

The also sell FIJI water for $1.79.  (My fave - and yes I can tell a difference.)

The iced coffee was very strong and a little burnt tasting - but suffice nonetheless.

The staff were just so friendly and accomodating - I can't believe it.  I'll be back!

What a great place!  This is the "real deal" Italian Food, the way it is meant to be - Concetta is lovely and there is an abundance of great food.  Chicken picatta is perfect in its simplicity.  Veal (or chicken) Marsala is delicious.  Bruscetta, marinated carrots, roasted red peppers and what?  Cornbread!  (Yes, you read that right - cornbread in with the Italian bread.)

Loud and raucous bar area, but it lends to the jovial atmosphere.
Parking is a NIGHTMARE.

Otherwise 5 stars.

You gotta come to Pesto.

I failed to consult with yelp before I purchased a $119 groupon for a (allegedly) $450 Boudoir photo session.
After the fact I messaged my fellow yelpers who all told me that it would suck at Tommi.

I have to say - I was very pleasantly proved wrong.

There are, however, some areas that need improvement.

Firstly, you must realize that the owners, Tommi & Nikki (Photog husband and his studio-manager wife) had great troubles with the (now) former manager.

They fired her - and most of the staff and brought in Pierre & Carlo (remember them from the bottom of the Bellevue??).  The new spa manager is a doll and customer service oriented.  She also wound up doing my make-up because... (area for improvement)...

They only allowed 30 minutes to do my hair & makeup for the photo shoot.  The (sweet, 23 year old) newbie hairdresser spent over 40 on my hair alone (and it was not what I wanted so she cheerfully re-did it and it was better then).  The 23 year old then had to leave so the manager (Raeleah?  I know I spelled that wrong) jumped in and quickly did my make-up (AWESOME job, By the way( before rushing off to do a waxing client.

They need to schedule a bit better.

OK, so now I'm all prettied-up and Tommi, Nikki and the Pierre & Carlo owner's wife (can't remember her name) - who I thought was "just" a photog assistant - did the shoot.

They shot for over the promised hour and took over 100 shots.

I am very pleased with the three 8 X 10s (they gave me one extra - the deal was for 2). and the retouching.

Tommi is, indeed, a good photographer.  I would consider him for a wedding (but the package prices are high) and am now considering having my child photographed (NOT Boudoir!!!).

For $119 - this was a great value.  (Hair & Makeup alone can easily run $100.)

I see improvements in Tommi already - so if you were here a few months ago or longer and got "burned" consider giving them another try.

I can't wait to test out their pedicure services.  I am STILL on the search for a decent spa pedi in Philly.  (Tierra Mia is the best I've found but soooo expensive and the "natural" polish doesn't last and she won't use my toxic OPI from home.)

The search continues.

Much love to Tommi & Nikki though - for a wonderful experience.
It's not every day that I get naked in front of total strangers.
The Black cat is a gift shop right next door to the White Dog Cafe.  They sell alot of cute, cute gift-y things here and jewelry.

Two words.

Taco Tuesdays!

They now offer (carry out only) $6.99 Daily Specials - and on Tuesdays - you can get tacos.  I got the fish tacos.  For $7.45 with tax - this is a great lunch!!!

Call your order in and they'll have it ready and waiting.

OMG!!!  On the advice of Danny Bonaduce (yes, really - we hear his ads for them EVERY morning on YSP) we took our 5 y.o. here for the $9.00 back to special hair cut.  It was perfect!  Even with the $4.00 tip we spent way less than we usually do.  (A kids cut at my guy is 20-25 - OUCH).

We will be back for sure - for a kid its great.
Not so sure if I am brave enough to actuallly get MY hair cut here though.

Yonny - the guy who own's this TINY spot - is a doll.  And his Cherry Street hideaway serves up a mean breakfast (even grits!) and cheap lunches.  Wish they were open on weekends - or even for dinner, but alas, Breakfast and Lunch M-F only.

All the teachers at my kid's daycare (Friends Child Care Center - next door) get their coffee and breakfast sandwiches here. They also serve hot grits - which I love to get "to go" in the winter.

Philly needs more places like this. Especially in the culinary wasteland of Broad & Vine.  Quizno's just won't cut it.

I only wish they were open for dinner!

Good food and GREAT service but the parking lot at lunchtime (mixed with the drive through line is an accident waiting to happen.  Treacherous.

Be very careful driving in and out of here.  So busy at lunch (Monday - Friday) you would think they were giving it away.

Beautiful architecture in a partially remodeled old building. Decent food and stellar service from Erin (our server) and Christine - at reception.

Food was just OK though and perhaps it was just that I ordered a salad.
A nice selection of Bigelow teas.

Great place to take a client.

I have been back several times for decent 3-4 star lunches now - usually alone.
Today I ordered the Tuna TarTar which was excellent but 1 problem.

It says PINE NUTS and mine came with PEANUTS.  That is a BIG difference in taste and in price.

I wanted Pine Nuts.

Meanwhile the tuna chunks and avocado were delicious and in a lovely dashi/soy.

The dinosaur eggs (Special)  are too gloppy for me - I much prefer the cripsy eggplant (also a Special) topped with a dollop of (not-very) spicy tuna. I now ask for "sauce on the side" as a common mantra.  It has saved many a dish for me.

2 pieces of (supposedly home-made) tamago (sushi or sashimi - I got sushi)  for $3.50 were good but not the best ever.  Home-made tamago is a thing of beauty and this seemed frozen - although they swear that the hef made it himself.
Maggiano's catered a large company meal for the holidays and did a great job (in our office).  Food was hot and tasty and the dessert platter was surprisingly luxe for a chain catering/dining place.

Update:  Took my 10 year old here for an early (4:30 PM) dinner and she just LOVED every bite of her Alaskan roll and Shrimp tempura roll (garnished with eel sauce).  She wants me to give this place 5 stars.

She also gobbled down a fair bit of my (pricey at $14.95) specialty roll (can't remember the name) with lobster salad.

Sushi chefs treated her well (we sat at the bar).
We'll be back very, very soon!

Smart kid!

TJ's is a fun place to shop with really friendly, quirky, tatooed and pierced staff.  I think a pre-requisite for employ is that you must let your freak flag fly.  But anyhow, if you go on a non-peak time, it is simply a PLEASURE to shop here.

At "peak" times (like after work or Saturdays) it gets a little crowded and the lines can be long.

But the selection of merchandise is what keeps me returning again and again.
Oh - that and that it's NEXT DOOR to my office.  SCORE!!!

Anyhow, this is not the greatest place for produce - alot of it is pre-packaged, but for FROZEN meals and appetizers, plus non-perishables from around the globe (Thai noodles, Indian curry kits, organic canned salmon, and dried fruits, nuts 7 trail mix.)

My ex-fiance SWORE by their coffee.  (And its a great value, too.)

I love Trader Joe's.

Now if only they' d figure out a way to have an entrance ON MARKET Street.

3 star service (Danny is terrific but the food came out rather slowly and we were on lunch break)
4 star food - upscale "gastropub" type bar food.

I had been wanting to try Roots, and my group of 5 coworkers came for lunch - we only had an hour and lunch took easily 85 minutes.  Next time we will advise the staff that we are on a tighter time frame.

3 of the crew had burgers and they looked terrific with any toppings you could want - cheddar, bacon, fried (a little over cooked for my liking) egg.

I had the $10 lunch special of French Onion Soup ($6 on its own!) and a 1/2 sandwich (I chose the Chicken, Avocado and Pork Belly panini - yes, please!).  Both were scrumptious - albeit caloric.  Best of all?  The French Onion was not overly salted.  It was perfect.

I will return - but not on a day when I have a 1 PM meeting!
Great selection of beers - and a full bar ('natch!)

Tried K of T again - this time for lunch with my vegetarian, Indian friend.  We split an order of Chana Chat - a cold chick pea appetizer that is very good.  (Still served on the bed of iceberg.)

I had the same shrimp appetizer with a freshly fried poori - it is an appetizer but for me was perfect for lunch.  It came with 4 medium sized shrimp in a tomato based (tasy) sauce with onions and green peppers.  The sauce was so good on the poori (or over rice - I snagged a bit of my friends HUGE veggie biryani).

I have never been a big Indian food lover, but I can deal with the food here and find it very good.

I shop here.
I admit it.  I do.

And I love that they carry Hint Water and a select aisle of organic goodies that I know and love.  Decent prices - and never that crowded on evenings or off hours.  (Weekends can get hectic.)

I prefer it to Acme, but will also shop there.

This place is too high priced for an every day lunch (at least for me - maybe it's fine for the attorneys with expense accounts) but - but - BUT...

TACO TUESDAYS!  (Take out only) gives you the (normally $11) fish tacos (2) with a side of black beans - to go - for $6.99 - about 7.60 with tax. Guac, Sourcream and some sort of chipotle crema (I get them all on the side).

That, I can live with.

I love Taco tuesdays at Du Jour.

Oh - and today I got a free breakfast sandwich (regularly $4.95 served with a small coffee) for signing up for their loyalty card.  The sandwich was great!  (Not sure if I can afford spending $5 on breakfast normally, though.)

Much better yogurt than Sweet Ending (even my 6 year old agrees) but we all like Yogorino's yogurt best (for taste - but not for toppings and certainly not for price).

Meanwhile, for 51 cent per oz., Tutti Frutti is a good "bang for the buck" in fro-yo land.  My little one got Orange, Pomegranate, Cheesecake and Plain (Tart) Yogurt) and covered it in fruit and candy.

I opted for a small bit of the tart classic plain with come blueberries and 2 mini-cream puffs on top.  The yogurt is so cold it froze the berries!  (The guy behind the counter - who is a doll and also easy on the eyes! - said than many people opt NOT to put gummy bears nor jelly beans because the yogurt freezes them rock-hard.)

So anyhow, we like Sweet Ending - sure - and we frequent the Rittenhouse one - but whenever we venture East of Broad and feel a fro-you craving coming on - the little one and I head straight to Tuttti Frutti.

Good stuff.

Stick to the Original Plain - it's the best (IMO).

An Italian Deli with a good assortment of REAL Italian meats and cheeses, plus dried pasta and olive oils.

A few hard to find items, too - and tomato pie and DiBruno Brothers products (a few) to save you a schlep to Philly.

A little taste of Sou-filly in good old "white bread" Aston.

The lady and young man working there were very nice to my 9 year also - who devoured a 1/4 lb of macaroni salad right IN the store.

Kudos to Ellen G. for telling me about this place.  It's in a strip mall which is one of 3 strip malls on 452 and that all look similar. I had driven right by many times and never thought to go in.  Big mistake - you gotta try this place.

I enjoyed my meal at Roys.  I had the 3 course prix-fish and the buttery fish (mahi mahi) was delicious.  Roy's has a hawaiian/asian fusion flair to it.  The non-alcoholic version of a ginger mojito I ordered had fresh mint, limes, ginger and pineapple.  So refreshing.  The deseerts and apps were tasty too.  It's hard to believe it's a chain that OutBack owns.

Prices are too high for the 1 oz sampler (4 one ounce bottles for $20?  Ouch).
The regular bottles (Oil or Vinegar) are all $16.95.

Truffle oils are (of course) higher.

I enjoyed sampling the single-note olive oils but the flavored ones (butter flavored??) did not thrill me.  Also the White Balsamic (I tried the Lemon one) was entirely too tart.

I really love REAL balsamic from Modena - so for me the vinegars were just OK - best ones are the fig and black cherry. (Sweet - of course) but the underlying vinegar is not the best I've ever had.

Good but not a holy grail.

That said - I bought a $17 bottle of arbequina oil for a friend and think she will enjoy it.

Let's hear it for my 1400th review on yelp.
Well - here it goes...

I just got back from a delicious lunch at Mixto with a good (vegetarian)  friend of mine.  After we each had a stiff, refreshing Classic Mojito each (and I was beginning to feel the buzz). Our friendly - if a little slow- waiter took our orders.

I had the Plato Vegetariano and my friend had a Salad with Avocado added on top.  Both were fresh and excellent.  I asked them to omit the tostones (green plantains) on my platter and sub maduros (sweet plantains) and thus I had an abundance of maduros to share with my friend.

I also gave him some of the Yucca, black beans and 1/4 of the SCRUMPTIOUS white corn arepa.

Wow.  I can not wait to go back.

Why not 5 stars?  A few reasons - in fact I was dithering between 3 & 4 stars.  Service here is, indeed, weird.  Since we arrive just before noon and the place was dead empty our service was better than it could have been - but I imagine at peak times this place is just NUTS.  They do kind-of check you out upon arrival.  The hostess was icy-cold.  Bus person (male) was very nice.

Also some might say that there are not enough vegetarian options - you basically can have salads or the plato - and that's it.  Fortunately I loved the plato - that arepa and the maduros were PERFECT.  It aslo had steamed (bland) veggies, yellow rice and a clump of mixed green salad in a tasty sweet dressing.

The mojios were STRONG and well muddled.  We went back again a few weeks later and had Vanilla and Pasion Fruit mojitos which were, indeed, sweeter but so delicious.  Oh - and the LARGE ($13) really is large.

I can't wait to return.  Again - I'll try for a non peak time. (The weekend madness here is just not for me.)

Oh - and they DON'T take reservations unless it's a party of 5 or more.

This is pretty much as "good as it gets" for a Fourbucks.
There is a drive through - but the walk-in service is even better with a spacious dining area - and super clean (brand new) facilities.

Excellent service and a full staff during the AM rush.

Plenty of parking.  Yay!!!

The staff here is terrific and remember me from the days "across the street" at the old location.  This location is much larger and has a drive though and takes up a large portion of the parking lot - so there is less parking for the stores in the strip mall and Acme.

Media needed this!!!

Taste of Puebla has set up a stand at the Media Farmers Market selling guacamole, pico de gallo and salsa fresca (verde). They are there every Thursday from 3 PM -8 PM.

All are very good as are ther chips.

Can't wait to go to the restaurant now!

5 stars for the donuts (have not yet tried the chicken).
I got 6 hots (2 of each flavor - strawberry, vanilla spice and coffee) and they were devoured by my friends and I.  SO good.

But - the line/queue system neeeds better signage and direction (like, chicken over here, donuts over there... etc.)

The crowds are crazy!!

Oh - and the fancy donuts sell out FAST so get there early.

Finally got to try house - and while the food was very good beware - service is SLOW.  Do NOT come here in a hurry.  It took 35 minutes to be served entrees (My friend's cup of tomato soup arrived right away and we all stared and watched him eat it.)

I tasted 1 spoonful of the tomato soup - it was drizzled with olive oil (just a bit) and tasted good but as others have said - not mindblowing.

The eggs benedict was EGGs-xcellent.  The crab avocado one and the spinach/tomato one were both great.

It took me a long while to come here and now I will definitely be back.
But not when I am in a hurry - and I will not come at 12 - closer to 11:30 is better.  The place gets packed at lunchtime.

I've had Old City iced coffee many, many times at the RTM location - but it was not until today that I had the pleasure (and it really, really was a true pleasure) to sit and linger (we scored a great outdoor table - they only have 2) over a yummy iced coffee (my friend had a HUGE mug of cappucino with a hearty cap of yummy foam in it - PERFECT!) in Old City today.

We had such a great time - and spent nearly 2 hours just drinkin', smokin', yakin' and having a great afternoon.

Thanks for NOT being a Charbucks.

Great coffee and a fun place to just hang out.
And 2 nice, young, handsome barristas - eye candy never hurts.

LOVE it here!  (Nearly gave then 5 stars)
Bountiful acres has been supplying Bucks COunty gardeners with plants and shrubs and floral supplies for YEARS and Years and years.

They have a large selection of live plants - and seasonally (especially in spring) there is an annual rush for annuals.

The staff (the ones who aren't teen-aged kids of the people who work there) are very knowledgeable about gardening and horticulture.  A great source for the home gardener.

The prices can be high (for some things - like flats of begonias or impatiens) but the quality is much higher than those same cheapie flat you could buy at K-Mart.  I really enjoy shopping here.

Oh - and Halloween at Bountful is SUCH fun.  Pumkins and gourds galore.

Great source for Christmas tress, swags, wreaths and greenery, too.

We had a marvelous time at RR last night - but we came with a group of 9 - a few straggled in later and seating for large groups is less than ideal.  Drinks were $12 as usual and the bartender's choice was perfect for me.  I had 3 "Blackmails" and one of my friends had 2 French 75's.

The Maloney swizzle is a colorful sweet treat as well.

Food was just OK. The cheese plate and chocolate mezcal popcorn were a hit, but the best bite of the night were the 2 orders of $10 (ouch) guacamole from El Rey's menu.

The charcutterie plate was uninspired and the raved about meatball sandwich was "meh" to me.  (Try the Turkey club instead.)

Service was good - but we got there the moment they opened and as it got busier (round about 8 PM) servise slowed down.  (This is to be expected).

Try to come early and leave before the "cool kids" arrive.

I still enjoy Ranstead - but now that I have been here thrice, no need to rush back.
And the $200+ tab was no joke!

P.S.  Bring a flashlight!!!!

Kafta Lamb Kebab over salad was great, Chicken Shwarma was too dry for me - but that said I did not load it down with sauces and tahini.  I did try the (very good) baba gahannouj and (not as good) garlic whip - on the side.  The Yogurt-Cucumber was very nice also.  Tomatoes and cukes were fresh.

I got in and out for $10.50 (including tax) and had a BIG whompin' bowl of Lebanese-inspired goodness.

I shall return.  The Qdoba of Middle Eastern.

Very, very pleased by our service from Sandy (and also Carol herself on the phone).
We were able to transfer title and tags easily.

Brava!

Note:  $5 fee for using a credit card to pay.  (They like cash.)

I have purchased pretzels and pretzel-dogs at a few locations in Center City Philly and they are always fresh and tasty.

Carbo-loaded goodness.

The frozen custard is quite good.  I am not a water ice eater - but I love the custard at Rita's.  News flask their "Gelatti" is NOT Gelatto.  It is a bastardizion combo of water ice and custard.  Whatever.  It tastes good.

I truly love this place (looks like nothing in a strip mall but PLEASE seek this place out).  Parmagiano Reggiano for $14.99 per lb?  Amazing.  Viso's cannoli shells.  Cookies.  Pastries. Pasta.  Eggplant (grilled in store).  So many cured meats.

The REAL deal Italian - plus deli stuff.  Snagged a dozen eggs for 89 cent.  89 CENTS!!!!!  Cheaper than any supermarket.

Owner is a very kind man and related to Claudio's in South Philly.

WE NEED MORE PLACES like this!  We need a REAL butcher shop.  Any takers?

Stopped in to inquire about wheatgrass - and they DO carry it.
Will be back later this week to get some.

Update:  Got a shot of wheat grass for $1.99 yesterday - EXCELLENT.
I will be back several times per week, budget permitting.

Friendly service - place was nearly empty at 12:45 PM on a Monday.

An old-fashined five 'n dime style "everything" store - stationary, household goods, kid stuff, party goods, wrapping paper, tools, socks.  A vast variety that is as close as Media, PA gets to the "Vermont COuntry Store".  A note of nostalgia and fun shopping here and a sweet lady at the cashier in the evening time on weekdays.

Louis B. gets it right!

Food is consistently good here and the market is great for Covid-Takeout when you don't want to cook.  The pistachio Chicken is amazing.

The full bar is great and live music when Covid and weather permits.

Sarah our server was friendly and attentive.

An enjoyable evening.

Since there is no Sephora in Media, we head to ULTA to play with SOME of the brands we like.  Lorac, Urband Decay, Murad, Dermalogica, Alterna, Redken, OPI.

The staff is not nearly as knowledgable as you might think - it really depends on the person and a few of the "gals" seem harried and hurried.

Also there is ALWAYS a line at check out. (At least on weekdays after 5 PM and Saturday mornings, which is usually when we go.

Read the circular, use your points - and some GREAT sales (Like LORAC glosses 50% off - $8 instead of $16) can be found!

Visited El Gran Rodeo with a friend and we sat in the bar area.
Enjoyed our Drinks (Mojito was perfect) and Hot Queso app.

Delicious burrito and chimichanga.

So great.

What a great spot for Mexican - and in a strip mall, no less.
Our excellent server (kinda looked like the guy from Entourage on TV) got my friend and I in and out of there quickly during a weekday lunch.

Oh - and they serve not only chips and salsa - but a spicy creamy ranch-like dip, too.  Good stuff.

Great lunch specials and reasonably priced.

Can't wait to try it again!

Very tasty food - but a bit too rich for my blood.
I would love to be able to cater my next party using DiFabio's - the pistachio crusted Chicken (fingers or breast") are truly delicious.

Friendly service.

Sigh...maybe next year.

Got some much needed dry dog food and dog supplements here - no issues and the manager was very helpful.  Prices are just OK but sales (if you can get 'em) are good.

Bonus - next door to Target so we can do both stores in one trip.

This place is so cute, it's PRECIOUS.  Everything from the cutesy sayings about their cash-only policy, to the old-fashioned cash register that rings up your order (manned by a very cute man dressed in white with a white paper soda-jerk hat!).

This place is a gem.  A true taste of nostalgia with home-made ice-cream and old-time soda fountain treats.  You can even get a NY style egg cream.

I would definitely come here.  It is a like a modern day trip down memory lane.  (And yummy, too.)

But bring the cash!  You'll need it.

3.5 stars is probably more accurate - but I am rounding up to 4 because my husband enjoyed it (he says it's better than Alma de Cuba - I disagree) and they were very accomodating to our 7 year old on a bustling Friday night.

Alma de Cuba is also great for its bar and party vibe.  My $9 Classic Mojito was perfect - not too strong (but if you like a strong drink you might not agree).

Vaca Frita, Ropa Vieja, Maduros, Chicken Empanada (a little small) and Classic Bean Beans & Rice were all they way "they are supposed to be".  Excellent Food, a bit high priced for cuban.

Better than Mixto, not quite as good (nor as pricey/trendy/hoity-toity) as Alma de Cuba (IMHO).

Go and enjoy.

Ryan - our server was cordial and attentive.  A great guy!

Many thanks to Alma de Cuba for participating in Friends Select School's Dining with Friends program.  We hope many people will come here!

So happy to have found this place - and for lunch ($7.95 Bun or Broken Rice Plates) oit is a steal.  Delicious Wonton Soup and Bun (Rice Vermicelli) bowls.
At dinner the carpaccio appetizer ($7.95) and  DELUXE Bun - with pork, chicken, meatballs (grilled to perfection and so juicy) and spring roll is super filling at $10.95.

Perfect Summer rolls.
Wonderful service from lovely ladies.

We'll be back - and I hope soon.

I can not say enough good things about Roz and her generosity. She provided Kosher Catering for an event we held at "The Expressive Hand" (a paint your own pttery place) and the food was simple and delicious.  Perfect for our group of 20-ish.

The cupcakes had a delicious icing - hard to believe they were dairy free!
I did not find the cupcakes to be "dry" or "lacking flavor" - I had the chocolate with chocolate icing and it was very good.

There was also a gogeous crudite tray with several types of hummus.

YUM!

Thanks, Roz.  We love working with you.

I like Grand Rodeo - mysterious "ranch dressing" white sauce and ketchup-y salsa and all.  It's great for families with or without kids.  Service (Kudos to Ricardo) was terrific even on a jam-packed (20 minute wait) Saturday night.

Love it here.

I have now been to 3 of the 5 (or is it 6) El Limon locations and I have just two words to say:

Al Pastor.

Seriously.  I have dreams about it.

Brand-new CFA serving up all your favorites with a cheerful "My Pleasure".
Closed Sundays.

Double-laned drive thru.

Always busy but so well managed.

A great place to pick up authentic Mexican products - and produce.
Plus fresh baked pastries and breads, canned goods like beans and chiles en adobada.

Nopales.
Chiles.
Frijoles.

Everything you need.

Soooooo close to 5 stars - and definitely 5 star service from Jack today for a leisurely, late lunch (L.L.L.) including that fantastic "power green" soup.  I just love it.  (Does contain dairy so not vegan - and very rich with cream and parmesan cheese thus negating the veggies.)

You gotta try that soup.

So delicious.

Still terrific and now some brand new digs!
Went to Gran Rodeo at the new location (down "the block" from the old building) twice now.  Much more space and a bigger, nicer bar area.

Food was great - cheese dip (with chips) never disappoints and shrimp fajitas and Chili Colorado were both tasty.  Pineapple Mojito (I asked for it light on the pineapple so it would not be too sweet) was spot-on!!!

Service was good but our one server was a bit grumpy
Bartender was friendly and funny and the lovely 2 hostess-ladies are so sweet whenever we come.

Love me some Gran Rodeo.

My review from 2 years ago still stands - service is slow but everything is cooked to order and tastes great.  The "green soup" - a hot soup with kale, broccoli and other greens, garnished with Parmesan, was delightful (special) and once again, I got the crab eggs Benedict.  Fan-flipping-tastic.  Amanda our server was terrific, too.

It's worth the wait (and there usually is one on weekends) so bring friends to chat with or a book or magazine and settle it for a leisurely brunch, lunch or breakfast at house.

We love it.

Fluctuates between 3 & 4 stars - our service happened to be wonderful - the food is always the same.  Reliable, good, not mind blowing - but the shrimp and beef filled items are very nice.  Our 11 year old just LOVES it here.  Guacamole is very bland - but made fresh.

Salsa tastes more like watery picante sauce.

Not a holy grail but OK for east-coast suburban.  For better Mexican try Dos Gringos in Media.

My kid and all her friends LOVE it here.
Especially the Burrito California with steak or shrimp (extra charge).

Well stocked Russian and Eastern European market with a vast selection of treats, snacks, candies, dairy, meat and prepared foods.

Really great.

Stick with salads, skip the overpriced drinks and you'll be ok.  The herb ranch dressing is actually fresh tasting.  I never get pizza here. 

Service by Ciara was very good.

Fantastic service for our pre-arranged buffet luncheon of 27 people by Jackie, Kaylie and the team.  Mustard Crusted Pork loin, Stuffed mushrooms, penne with chicken, Caesar Salad and rolls.

Parfaits for dessert.

Wonderful place for an old-school (bring your grandparents) luncheon.

Our little one loves it here - the fountain, the water area, the trails, the garden/landscape and Milk & Honey Cafe.  Plus 24 hour security to keep the homeless folks from settling in permanently.

A great place for families with kids.

This Acme has beer & wine (a pretty decent selection, too) available.  They also have a sushi section, next to the deli and hot foods bars.

Crowded on weekends - but a great place to get everything you need in this area of Ridley.

We love sitting in Brett's section and get treated royally whenever we come to RAH (which is now about once a month).

Food is OK - wish they had some healthier (veggie) side items.  Steamed Broccoli or Spinach?  I'm in!

I had an old-school "Fuzzy Navel" and it was delicious and not too cloyingly sweet and got me quite buzzed.  (I know, I know - LIGHTWEIGHT!).

Good times!

My man bought me a gorgeous ring at the Deptford location of Pandora.
In general, Pandora has beautiful stuff - but it is costume jewelry.  Rose gold PLATING over a mixed metal base and CZ's - not real diamonds.

In any case, I really like the ring and I love him so I wear it all the time.
We'll see how it stands up to handwashing, lotions and creams (yes, I take it off - but still).

A nice place for gifts.
